sn35.23:1.2: “Mendicants, I will teach you the all.
sn35.23:1.5: It’s just the eye and sights, the ear and sounds, the nose and smells, the tongue and tastes, the body and touches, and the mind and thoughts.
sn35.23:1.7: Mendicants, suppose someone was to say:
sn35.23:1.8: ‘I’ll reject this all and describe another all.’ They’d have no grounds for that,
sn35.23:1.9: they’d be stumped by questions, and, in addition, they’d get frustrated.
sn35.23:1.11: Because they’re out of their element.”
